text.section:
A person is guilty of bigamy when he:
Purports to marry another person knowing he has a husband or wife or knowing the other person has a husband or wife; or
Cohabits in this state after a bigamous marriage in another state.
It shall be a defense to bigamy that the accused believed he was legally eligible to remarry.
Bigamy is a Class D felony.

law.history: Created 1974 Ky. Acts ch. 406, sec. 257, effective January 1, 1975.
